___MemberIdentifier.description: Identifier assigned to person registered with travel club.

___Privacy.description: Allows for control of the sharing of data between parties.

___Date_EffectiveExpire.description: Used to identify the effective date and/or expiration date.

___language.description: The language the name is represented in, e.g. an Eastern name versus a Western name.

___defaultInd.description: If true, this is the default or primary name within a collection of names.

___type.description: Type of name of the individual, such as former, nickname, alternate or alias name. Refer to OpenTravel Code List Name Type (NAM).

___Privacy.description: Allows for control of the sharing of data between parties.

___Surname.description:
Family name, last name. 
Note: Simple form of person name should be used for the full name.
May also be used for full name if the sending system does not have the ability to separate a full name into its parts, e.g. the surname element may be used to pass the full name.

___Person_Document.description: Document  information for verification purposes and also used for additional filtering for common names.

$eref.description: Information about a telephone number, including the actual number and its usage.

___countryAccessCode.description: Code assigned by telecommunications authorities for international country access identifier.

___areaCityCode.description: Code assigned for telephones in a specific region, city, or area.

___phoneNumber.description: Telephone number assigned to a single location.

___extension.description: Extension to reach a specific party at the phone number.

___id.description: Used elsewhere in the message to reference a specific telephone number (including faxes).

___remark.description: A remark associated with the telephone number.

___defaultInd.description: When true, indicates a default value should be used.

___PhoneUseType.description: Describes the type of telephone number, in the context of its general use (e.g. Home, Business, Emergency Contact, Travel Arranger, Day, Evening). Refer to OpenTravel Code List Phone Use Type (PUT).

___pIN.description: Additional codes used for pager or telephone access rights.

___PhoneTechType.description: Indicates type of technology associated with this telephone number, such as Voice, Data, Fax, Pager, Mobile, TTY, etc.

___Privacy.description: Allows for control of the sharing of data between parties.

___PhoneLocationType.description: Describes the location of the phone, such as Home, Office, Property Reservation Office, etc.

$eref.description: Information about a telephone number, including the actual number and its usage.

___language.description: The language for this paragraph.

___name.description: This will allow you to define the information that is being sent, typically used when multiple occurrences of ParagraphType are being sent.

___DateTimeStamp.description: Creation date time, Creator ID, last modification date time and last modifier ID for the paragraph.

___number.description: The sequence number for the paragraph.

___EndWindow.description: The earliest and latest dates acceptable for the end date.

___StartWindow.description: The earliest and latest dates acceptable for the start date.

___DurationUnit.description: The unit of elapsed time or the day of the week applied to the value.

___DocType.description: Indicates the type of document (e.g. Passport, Military ID, Drivers License, national ID, Vaccination Certificate). Refer to OpenTravel Code List Document Type (DOC).

$eref.description: An identifier of the entity making the request (e.g. ATA/IATA/ID number, Electronic Reservation Service Provider (ERSP), Association of British Travel Agents.(ABTA)).

___Identifier.description: An identifier of the entity making the request (e.g. ATA/IATA/ID number, Electronic Reservation Service Provider (ERSP), Association of British Travel Agents.(ABTA)).

___name.description: The name of the person making the request- may be the travel agent, a traveler on a direct booking, or a third party.

___messagePassword.description: This password provides an additional level of security that the recipient can use to validate the sending party's authority to use the message.

$eref.description: An identifier of the entity making the request (e.g. ATA/IATA/ID number, Electronic Reservation Service Provider (ERSP), Association of British Travel Agents.(ABTA)).

___agentDutyCode.description: An authority code assigned to a requestor.

___terminalID.description: This is the electronic address of the device from which information is entered.

___RequestorID.description: An identifier of the entity making the request (e.g. ATA/IATA/ID number, Electronic Reservation Service Provider (ERSP), Association of British Travel Agents.(ABTA)).

___agentSine.description: Identifies the party within the requesting entity.

___eRSP_UserID.description: TODO-(Should this be an Identifier)Electronic Reservation Service Provider (ERSP) assigned identifier used to identify the individual using the ERSP system.

___Position.description: Specifies the latitude and longitude of a source.

___firstDepartPoint.description: TODO-(Code??)The point of first departure in a trip.

___pseudoCityCode.description: An identification code assigned to an office/agency by a reservation system.

___BookingChannel.description: Specifies the booking channel type and whether it is the primary means of connectivity of the source.

___primaryInd.description: Indicates whether the enumerated booking channel is the primary means of connectivity used by the source.

___type.description: The type of booking channel (e.g. Global Distribution System (GDS), Alternative Distribution System (ADS), Sales and Catering System (SCS), Property Management System (PMS), Central Reservation System (CRS), Tour Operator System (TOS), Internet and ALL). Refer to OpenTravel Code List Booking Channel Type (BCT).

___CompanyName.description: Identifies the company that is associated with the booking channel.

___Status.description: If present, recommended values are those enumerated in the Status_Enum(NotProcessed | Incomplete | Complete | Unknown) however, the data type is designated an open enumeration, recognizing that trading partners may identify additional status conditions not included in the enumeration.

$eref.description: Textual information.

___name.description: Used to identify the information found in the comment.

___language.description: Identifies the language of the comment.

$eref.description: Textual information.

___Identifier.description:
Identifier provides the ability to create a globally unique identifier. For the identifier to be globally unique it must have a system provided identifier and the system must be identified using a global naming authority. System identification uses the domain naming system (DNS) to assure they are globally unique and should be an URL. The system provided ID will typically be a primary or surrogate key in a database.

The URL, system and company attributes can be omitted only when the system context can be implied by a parent or ancestor element.

An identifier used to uniquely reference an object in a system (e.g. an airline reservation reference, customer profile reference, booking confirmation number, or a reference to a previous availability quote).

___id.description: Provides a unique reference to this contact person.

___birthDate.description: The birth date of the person.

___Privacy.description: Allows for control of the sharing of data between parties.

___Telephone.description: Information about a telephone number, including the actual number and its usage.

___maritalStatus_Enum.description: Specifies the marital status of the person.

$eref.description: Provides address information. Unformatted addresses are captured using the simple facet.

___Number.description: May contain the street number and optionally the street name.

___Street.description: May contain the street number when the Street number element is missing.

___City.description: City (e.g., Dublin), town, or postal station (i.e., a postal service territory, often used in a military address).

___language.description: Example: en

___type.description: Defines the type of address (e.g. home, business, other). Refer to OpenTravel Code List Communication Location Type (CLT).

___Privacy.description: Allows for control of the sharing of address information between parties.

___Remark.description: A remark associated with this address.

examples.value: This address should be used for all official correspondences.

___use.description: Describes the use of the address (e.g. mailing, delivery, billing, etc.). Refer to OpenTravel Code List Address Use Type (AUT).

___validInd.description: If true, this is a valid and complete mailing address that has been verified through an address verification service or previously mailed materials have not been returned.

$eref.description: Full name.
An error or warning code.
The error in textual format.

___language.description: The language in which the error is returned.

___shortText.description: An abbreviated version of the error in textual format.

___code.description: If present, this refers to a table of coded values exchanged between applications to identify errors or warnings. Refer to OpenTravel Code List Error Codes (ERR).

___recordID.description: If present, this attribute allows for batch processing and the identification of the record that failed amongst a group of records. This value may contain a concatenation of a unique failed transaction ID with specific record(s) associated with that transaction.

___DocURL.description: If present, this URL refers to an online description of the error that occurred.

___nodeList.description: An XPath expression that selects all the nodes whose data caused this error. Further, this expression should have an additional contraint which contains the data of the node. This will provide the offending data back to systems that cannot maintain the original message.

___tag.description: If present, this attribute may identify an unknown or misspelled tag that caused an error in processing. It is recommended that the Tag attribute use XPath notation to identify the location of a tag in the event that more than one tag of the same name is present in the document. Alternatively, the tag name alone can be used to identify missing data [Type=ReqFieldMissing].

___Status.description: If present, recommended values are those enumerated in the Status_Enum(NotProcessed | Incomplete | Complete | Unknown) however, the data type is designated an open enumeration, recognizing that trading partners may identify additional status conditions not included in the enumeration.

$eref.description: The error in textual format.

___shortText.description: An abbreviated version of the error in textual format.

___code.description: If present, this refers to a table of coded values exchanged between applications to identify errors or warnings. Refer to OpenTravel Code List Error Codes (ERR).

___recordID.description: If present, this attribute allows for batch processing and the identification of the record that failed amongst a group of records. This value may contain a concatenation of a unique failed transaction ID with specific record(s) associated with that transaction.

___DocURL.description: If present, this URL refers to an online description of the error that occurred.

___nodeList.description: An XPath expression that selects all the nodes whose data caused this error. Further, this expression should have an additional contraint which contains the data of the node. This will provide the offending data back to systems that cannot maintain the original message.

It is recommended that the Tag attribute use XPath notation to identify the location of a tag in the event that more than one tag of the same name is present in the document. Alternatively, the tag name alone can be used to identify missing data [Type=ReqFieldMissing].

A string intended for free text 
Minimum length of 0 and maximum length of 4096

Identifier provides the ability to create a globally unique identifier. For the identifier to be globally unique it must have a system provided identifier and the system must be identified using a global naming authority. System identification uses the domain naming system (DNS) to assure they are globally unique and should be an URL. The system provided ID will typically be a primary or surrogate key in a database.

The URL, system and company attributes can be omitted only when the system context can be implied by a parent or ancestor element.

___company.description: Name of the company that manages the reference system.

___url.description: Uri of the creating system. The URI should be an URL and be globally unique. Should only be omitted when the context is clearly implied for the containing document.

___instance.description: The identification of a record as it exists at a point in time. An instance is used in update messages where the sender must assure the server that the update sent refers to the most recent modification level of the object being updated.

___system.description: Name or identifier for the creating system.

___Identifier.description:
Identifier provides the ability to create a globally unique identifier. For the identifier to be globally unique it must have a system provided identifier and the system must be identified using a global naming authority. System identification uses the domain naming system (DNS) to assure they are globally unique and should be an URL. The system provided ID will typically be a primary or surrogate key in a database.

The URL, system and company attributes can be omitted only when the system context can be implied by a parent or ancestor element.

___Date_EffectiveExpire.description: Used to identify the effective date and/or expiration date.

_88Identifier.description:
Identifier provides the ability to create a globally unique identifier. For the identifier to be globally unique it must have a system provided identifier and the system must be identified using a global naming authority. System identification uses the domain naming system (DNS) to assure they are globally unique and should be an URL. The system provided ID will typically be a primary or surrogate key in a database.

The URL, system and company attributes can be omitted only when the system context can be implied by a parent or ancestor element.

$eref.description:
A short string  
Minimum length of 0 and a maximum length of 128

___company.description: Name of the company that manages the reference system.

___url.description: Uri of the creating system. The URI should be an URL and be globally unique. Should only be omitted when the context is clearly implied for the containing document.

___instance.description: The identification of a record as it exists at a point in time. An instance is used in update messages where the sender must assure the server that the update sent refers to the most recent modification level of the object being updated.

$eref.description:
A short string  
Minimum length of 0 and a maximum length of 128

___system.description: Name or identifier for the creating system.

___purge.description: Date an item will be purged from a database (e.g., from a live database to an archive).

$eref.description:
A short string  
Minimum length of 0 and a maximum length of 128

___creatorID.description: ID of creator. The creator could be a software system identifier or an identifier of an employee resposible for the creation.

A short string  
Minimum length of 0 and a maximum length of 128

___lastModifierID.description: Identifies the last software system or person to modify a record.

___Identifier.description:
Identifier provides the ability to create a globally unique identifier. For the identifier to be globally unique it must have a system provided identifier and the system must be identified using a global naming authority. System identification uses the domain naming system (DNS) to assure they are globally unique and should be an URL. The system provided ID will typically be a primary or surrogate key in a database.

The URL, system and company attributes can be omitted only when the system context can be implied by a parent or ancestor element.

$eref.description: Provides address information. Unformatted addresses are captured using the simple facet.

___Number.description: May contain the street number and optionally the street name.

___Street.description: May contain the street number when the Street number element is missing.

___City.description: City (e.g., Dublin), town, or postal station (i.e., a postal service territory, often used in a military address).

$eref.description: Web site address, in IETF specified format.

___defaultInd.description: Indicates whether or not this is the default URL.

___type.description: Defines the purpose of the URL address, such as personal, business, public, etc.

$eref.description: Electronic email addresses, in IETF specified format.

___remark.description: A remark associated with the e-mail address.

___defaultInd.description: If true, this identifies this is the default email address.

___optInStatus.description: If present and set to opt out, a customer has explicitly opted out of marketing communication. When set to opt out it overrides the ShareMarketInd.

___optInDate.description: The date and time of opt in.

___emailType.description: Defines the purpose of the e-mail address (e.g. personal, business, listserve). Refer to OpenTravel Code List Email Address Type (EAT).

___optOutDate.description: The date and time of opt out.

___shareSyncInd.description: Permission for sharing data for synchronization of information held by other travel service providers.

___shareMarketInd.description: Permission for sharing data for marketing purposes.

___validInd.description: If true, this is a valid email address that has been system verified via a successful email transmission.

$eref.description: Information about a telephone number, including the actual number and its usage.

___countryAccessCode.description: Code assigned by telecommunications authorities for international country access identifier.

___areaCityCode.description: Code assigned for telephones in a specific region, city, or area.

___phoneNumber.description: Telephone number assigned to a single location.

___extension.description: Extension to reach a specific party at the phone number.

___id.description: Used elsewhere in the message to reference a specific telephone number (including faxes).

$eref.description: ISO 3 char  language code defined in  ISO639-2

___language.description: The language in which the error is returned.

$eref.description:
A short string  
Minimum length of 0 and a maximum length of 128

___shortText.description: An abbreviated version of the error in textual format.

$eref.description: Used for codes in the OpenTravel Code tables. Possible values of this pattern are 1, 101, 1001, 101.EQP, 1001.EQP or 1001.EQP.X.

___code.description: If present, this refers to a table of coded values exchanged between applications to identify errors or warnings. Refer to OpenTravel Code List Error Codes (ERR).

$eref.description: A string used for an open enumeration literal value.
A string with a minimum length of 0 and a maximum length of 512.

A short string  
Minimum length of 0 and a maximum length of 128

___recordID.description: If present, this attribute allows for batch processing and the identification of the record that failed amongst a group of records. This value may contain a concatenation of a unique failed transaction ID with specific record(s) associated with that transaction.

$eref.description: A string used for an open enumeration literal value.

___DocURL.description: If present, this URL refers to an online description of the error that occurred.

$eref.description: A string with a minimum length of 0 and a maximum length of 512.

___nodeList.description: An XPath expression that selects all the nodes whose data caused this error. Further, this expression should have an additional contraint which contains the data of the node. This will provide the offending data back to systems that cannot maintain the original message.

$eref.description: A string with a minimum length of 0 and a maximum length of 512.

___tag.description: If present, this attribute may identify an unknown or misspelled tag that caused an error in processing. It is recommended that the Tag attribute use XPath notation to identify the location of a tag in the event that more than one tag of the same name is present in the document. Alternatively, the tag name alone can be used to identify missing data [Type=ReqFieldMissing].

_88Employee.description: Employment identification; using an employee ID number, title, level within the company, and an indication of their status (e.g., active, retired, on leave, or terminated from employment).  Additional information about an employee can be entered into the element, including the name of the employee, if it differs from the person name identified as a customer or contact.

___id.description: Provides a unique reference to this contact person.

___birthDate.description: The birth date of the person.

___language.description: The language the name is represented in, e.g. an Eastern name versus a Western name.

___defaultInd.description: If true, this is the default or primary name within a collection of names.

___type.description: Type of name of the individual, such as former, nickname, alternate or alias name. Refer to OpenTravel Code List Name Type (NAM).

___Privacy.description: Allows for control of the sharing of data between parties.

___Surname.description:
Family name, last name. 
Note: Simple form of person name should be used for the full name.
May also be used for full name if the sending system does not have the ability to separate a full name into its parts, e.g. the surname element may be used to pass the full name.

___Person_Document.description: Document  information for verification purposes and also used for additional filtering for common names.

_88TimeSpan.description: Specifies the arrival date and departure date which covers the whole Reservation.

$eref.description:
XSD DateTime allows either a time-zone specification or allows the time-zone to be omitted. 
When omitted, times are "local". XSD DateTime with either a "Z" or a "+/-hh:mm" value are UTC. Time is the time "in the indicated time zone". When a element or attribute has xsd:dateTime type, the data in a message can be either local or UTC and software can easily determine which it is.

___start.description: Specifies the start date for the booking as a whole.

$eref.description:
XSD DateTime allows either a time-zone specification or allows the time-zone to be omitted. 
When omitted, times are "local". XSD DateTime with either a "Z" or a "+/-hh:mm" value are UTC. Time is the time "in the indicated time zone". When a element or attribute has xsd:dateTime type, the data in a message can be either local or UTC and software can easily determine which it is.

___end.description: Specifies the end date for the booking as a whole.

The URL, system and company attributes can be omitted only when the system context can be implied by a parent or ancestor element.

___url.description: Uri of the creating system. The URI should be an URL and be globally unique. Should only be omitted when the context is clearly implied for the containing document.

___instance.description: The identification of a record as it exists at a point in time. An instance is used in update messages where the sender must assure the server that the update sent refers to the most recent modification level of the object being updated.

___system.description: Name or identifier for the creating system.

$eref.description:
Identifier provides the ability to create a globally unique identifier. For the identifier to be globally unique it must have a system provided identifier and the system must be identified using a global naming authority. System identification uses the domain naming system (DNS) to assure they are globally unique and should be an URL. The system provided ID will typically be a primary or surrogate key in a database.

The URL, system and company attributes can be omitted only when the system context can be implied by a parent or ancestor element.

___company.description: Name of the company that manages the reference system.

___url.description: Uri of the creating system. The URI should be an URL and be globally unique. Should only be omitted when the context is clearly implied for the containing document.

___instance.description: The identification of a record as it exists at a point in time. An instance is used in update messages where the sender must assure the server that the update sent refers to the most recent modification level of the object being updated.

___system.description: Name or identifier for the creating system.

___Identifier.description: An identifier used to uniquely reference an object in a system (e.g. an airline reservation reference, customer profile reference, booking confirmation number, or a reference to a previous availability quote).

___id.description: Provides a unique reference to this contact person.

$eref.description: Information about a telephone number, including the actual number and its usage.

___countryAccessCode.description: Code assigned by telecommunications authorities for international country access identifier.

___areaCityCode.description: Code assigned for telephones in a specific region, city, or area.

___phoneNumber.description: Telephone number assigned to a single location.

___extension.description: Extension to reach a specific party at the phone number.

___id.description: Used elsewhere in the message to reference a specific telephone number (including faxes).

$eref.description:
A string intended for free text 
Minimum length of 0 and maximum length of 4096

___remark.description: A remark associated with the telephone number.

___defaultInd.description: When true, indicates a default value should be used.

___PhoneUseType.description: Describes the type of telephone number, in the context of its general use (e.g. Home, Business, Emergency Contact, Travel Arranger, Day, Evening). Refer to OpenTravel Code List Phone Use Type (PUT).

$eref.description:
A tiny string  
Minimum length of 0 and a maximum length of 32

___pIN.description: Additional codes used for pager or telephone access rights.

___PhoneTechType.description: Indicates type of technology associated with this telephone number, such as Voice, Data, Fax, Pager, Mobile, TTY, etc.

$eref.description: Allows for control of the sharing of data between parties.

___optInStatus.description: If present and set to opt out, a customer has explicitly opted out of marketing communication. When set to opt out it overrides the ShareMarketInd.

___optInDate.description: The date and time of opt in.

___optOutDate.description: The date and time of opt out.

___shareSyncInd.description: Permission for sharing data for synchronization of information held by other travel service providers.

___shareMarketInd.description: Permission for sharing data for marketing purposes.

___Privacy.description: Allows for control of the sharing of data between parties.

___PhoneLocationType.description: Describes the location of the phone, such as Home, Office, Property Reservation Office, etc.

_88TelephoneDetail.description: Information about a telephone number, including the actual number and its usage.

_88Telephone_AreaCityCode.description: Code assigned for telephones in a specific region, city, or area.

$eref.description: Used for codes in the OpenTravel Code tables. Possible values of this pattern are 1, 101, 1001, 101.EQP, 1001.EQP or 1001.EQP.X.

___EndWindow.description: The earliest and latest dates acceptable for the end date.

___StartWindow.description: The earliest and latest dates acceptable for the start date.

___DurationUnit.description: The unit of elapsed time or the day of the week applied to the value.

_88ErrorMessage_Enum.description: A textual description to provide more information about the specific error.

$eref.description: A string used for an open enumeration literal value.
A textual description to provide more information about the specific error.

_88Code_Passenger.description: Passenger type code containing 3 alpha characters as defined by ATPCO.

$eref.description: When the address is unformatted (FormattedInd="false") these lines will contain free form address details. When the address is formatted and street number and street name must be sent independently, the street number will be sent using StreetNmbr, and the street name will be sent in the first AddressLine occurrence.

_88AccessType_ReadWrite.description: Specifies the type of access that the organization has.

$eref.description:
A short string  
Minimum length of 0 and a maximum length of 128

_88Telephone_Simple.description:
A short string  
Minimum length of 0 and a maximum length of 128

$eref.description: A string used for an open enumeration literal value.
Simple text content.

_88Price.description: Specifies price after all applicable taxes of a product such as the rate for a room or fare for a flight.

$eref.description: Currency code - Preferred currencty code is a 3 char currency code as defined in ISO 4127

___currencyCode.description: The currency code for the amount.

___amountBeforeTax.description: The price before taxes are applied.

_88StateProv_Name.description: State, province, or region name or code needed to identify location.

$eref.description: The standard code or abbreviation for the state, province, or region.

___stateCode.description: The standard code or abbreviation for the state, province, or region.

$eref.description: A string with a minimum length of 0 and a maximum length of 512.

_88Text_Free.description: Textual information to provide descriptions and/or additional information.

___language.description: Language of the text.

$eref.description:
A string intended for free text 
Minimum length of 0 and maximum length of 4096

_88RequestorID.description: An identifier of the entity making the request (e.g. ATA/IATA/ID number, Electronic Reservation Service Provider (ERSP), Association of British Travel Agents.(ABTA)).

For the identifier to be globally unique it must have a system provided identifier and the system must be identified using a global naming authority. System identification uses the domain naming system (DNS) to assure they are globally unique and should be an URL. The system provided ID will typically be a primary or surrogate key in a database.

___company.description: Name of the company that manages the reference system.

___url.description: Uri of the creating system. The URI should be an URL and be globally unique. Should only be omitted when the context is clearly implied for the containing document.

___Surname.description:
Family name, last name. 
Note: Simple form of person name should be used for the full name.
May also be used for full name if the sending system does not have the ability to separate a full name into its parts, e.g. the surname element may be used to pass the full name.
